rayroom.core module

class rayroom.core.RayTracer(room, temperature=20.0, humidity=50.0)[source]

Bases: object

Main ray tracing engine for room acoustics simulation.

This class handles the emission, propagation, reflection, and absorption of sound rays within a defined room geometry.

run(n_rays=10000, max_hops=50, energy_threshold=1e-06, record_paths=False)[source]

Run the acoustic simulation.

Emits rays from all sources in the room and traces their paths until they are absorbed or reach the maximum number of reflections.

Parameters:

  • n_rays (int) – Number of rays to cast per source. Defaults to 10000.

  • max_hops (int) – Maximum number of reflections (hops) per ray. Defaults to 50.

  • energy_threshold (float) – Energy level below which a ray is stopped. Defaults to 1e-6.

  • record_paths (bool) – Whether to record and return the geometric paths of all rays (memory intensive). Defaults to False.

Returns:

Dictionary mapping source names to lists of ray paths if record_paths is True, else None.

Return type:

dict or None

rayroom.geometry module

rayroom.geometry.is_point_in_polygon(point, vertices, normal)[source]

Check if a point lying on the polygon’s plane is inside the polygon.

Uses the crossing number algorithm projected to 2D (dropping the dimension with the largest normal component).

Parameters:

  • point (np.ndarray) – Point to check [x, y, z].

  • vertices (np.ndarray) – Vertices of the polygon.

  • normal (np.ndarray) – Normal vector of the polygon’s plane.

Returns:

True if the point is inside, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

rayroom.geometry.ray_plane_intersection(ray_origin, ray_dir, plane_point, plane_normal)[source]

Calculate the intersection point of a ray and a plane.

Parameters:

  • ray_origin (np.ndarray) – Origin point of the ray [x, y, z].

  • ray_dir (np.ndarray) – Direction vector of the ray [x, y, z].

  • plane_point (np.ndarray) – A point on the plane [x, y, z].

  • plane_normal (np.ndarray) – Normal vector of the plane [x, y, z].

Returns:

The distance t along the ray to the intersection point, or None if no intersection. Intersection point = ray_origin + t * ray_dir.

Return type:

float or None

rayroom.audio module

class rayroom.audio.AudioRenderer(room, fs=44100, temperature=20.0, humidity=50.0)[source]

Bases: object

Handles the audio rendering pipeline for a Room.

Manages sources, audio data, ray tracing, Room Impulse Response (RIR) generation, convolution, and mixing to produce the final audio output for each receiver.

render(n_rays=20000, max_hops=50, rir_duration=2.0, verbose=True, record_paths=False)[source]

Run the full rendering pipeline.

  1. Traces rays for each source.

  2. Generates an energy histogram for each receiver.

  3. Converts histograms to RIRs.

  4. Convolves source audio with RIRs.

  5. Mixes output for each receiver.

Parameters:

  • n_rays (int) – Number of rays per source. Defaults to 20000.

  • max_hops (int) – Maximum reflections. Defaults to 50.

  • rir_duration (float) – Duration of the generated Impulse Response in seconds. Defaults to 2.0.

  • verbose (bool) – Print progress. Defaults to True.

  • record_paths (bool) – Return ray paths for visualization. Defaults to False.

Returns:

If record_paths is False, returns a dict {receiver_name: mixed_audio_array}. If True, returns tuple (receiver_outputs, paths_data).

Return type:

dict or tuple

set_source_audio(source, audio_data, gain=1.0)[source]

rayroom.audio.generate_rir(energy_histogram, fs=44100, duration=None)[source]

Convert an energy histogram to a Room Impulse Response (RIR).

It reconstructs the impulse response by placing random-phase impulses at arrival times with amplitudes scaled by the square root of energy.

Parameters:

  • energy_histogram (list[tuple]) – List of (time, energy) tuples.

  • fs (int) – Sampling rate in Hz. Defaults to 44100.

  • duration (float, optional) – Length of IR in seconds. If None, fits to max arrival time.

Returns:

The audio impulse response array.

Return type:

np.ndarray
